free.util
Class Connection

java.lang.Object
  free.util.Connection
Direct Known Subclasses:
ChessclubConnection, FreechessConnection
public abstract class Connection
extends java.lang.Object

This is the base class for all classes that define a connection to some server. It implements the framework for the connection.

Field Detail

sock

protected java.net.Socket sock
The socket to the server.

Constructor Detail

Connection

public Connection(java.lang.String hostname,
                  int port,
                  java.lang.String requestedUsername,
                  java.lang.String password)
Creates a new Connection. Note that the Connection is initially unconnected, after creating the session, you can adjust the various Connection settings and then call the connect() method.

Parameters:
hostname - The server we will connect to.
port - The port we will connect on.
username - The name of the account, note that the actual username may be assigned by the server and will thus be known only after the login procedure is done.
password - The password of the account.
Method Detail

connectAndLogin

public boolean connectAndLogin()
                        throws java.io.IOException
Connects and logs in to the server. Returns true if the procedure finished successfully, false otherwise. The reason for login failure may be obtained via the getLoginErrorMessage() method. Note that this method blocks until the connection is established and the login procedure is finished. Also note that since communication with the reader thread is done via the execRunnable(Runnable) method, and in order to complete the login procedure, communication with it is required, this method should NOT be called in the same thread execRunnable(Runnable) executes the runnable. Doing that will cause this method to never return.

Returns:
True if the connection and login procedure finished successfully, false otherwise.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occured when connecting to the server.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - If a connection was already established.
See Also:
isConnected(), disconnect()

login

protected abstract boolean login()
                          throws java.io.IOException
Goes through the login procedure and returns true if it's successful, false otherwise. This method is responsible for setting the username assigned by the server or the login error message via the setUsername(String) and setLoginErrorMessage methods respectively.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

createSocket

protected java.net.Socket createSocket(java.lang.String hostname,
                                       int port)
                                throws java.io.IOException
Creates and connects a socket to the given host on the given port.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

createReaderThread

protected abstract java.lang.Thread createReaderThread()
                                                throws java.io.IOException
Creates (but not starts) a new Thread that will do the reading from the server.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

isLoggedIn

public boolean isLoggedIn()
Returns true if this Connection is logged in.

onLogin

protected void onLogin()
This method is called right after the login, in the handler thread (the one in which things are called when you invoke execRunnable()). The default implementation does nothing.

getUsername

public java.lang.String getUsername()
Returns the username assigned by the server, this may be null until the session is logged on.

See Also:
isLoggedIn()

setUsername

protected void setUsername(java.lang.String username)
Sets the username assigned by the server. This method may only be called once, and it should be called from the login() method.

See Also:
getUsername()

getLoginErrorMessage

public java.lang.String getLoginErrorMessage()
Returns the login error message. Note that this may return null even if the login failed.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if a connection hasn't been established yet or the login did not fail.

setLoginErrorMessage

protected void setLoginErrorMessage(java.lang.String message)
Sets the login error message to the specified string.

getRequestedUsername

public java.lang.String getRequestedUsername()
Returns the username requested by the user. This is never null, but note that the server may assign a different username from the requested one.

getPassword

protected java.lang.String getPassword()
Returns the password of the account.

getHostname

public java.lang.String getHostname()
Returns the hostname of the server.

getPort

public int getPort()
Returns the port on which we are connecting.

disconnect

public void disconnect()
                throws java.io.IOException
Disconnects from the server.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occured when disconnecting from the server
See Also:
isConnected(), #connect()

isConnected

public boolean isConnected()
Returns true if this Connection is connected to the server, false otherwise.

See Also:
#connect(), disconnect()

execRunnable

public void execRunnable(java.lang.Runnable runnable)
This method should be called by the ReaderThread to execute given code on the data handling thread. This is needed to allow graphical applications using the Connection to make sure that their handling code is executed on the AWT thread thus avoiding multi-threading problems. The default implementation of this method, meant for non-graphical applications, such as bots, simply invokes the run() method of the Runnable in the current thread. Note that it's important that the runnable is always run in one thread, so you can't do load balancing from here.
